snippet: President Joachim Gauck and President François Hollande of France joined hands on Wednesday in a ceremony commemorating the massacre of Oradour-sur-Glane, in central France, by Nazis.
abstract: Germany's Pres Joachim Gauck and his French counterpart Francois Hollande join hands in ceremony commemorating the massacre of Oradour-sur-Glane, in central France, where Nazi troops killed 642 villagers in 1944; it is first time since World War II that a German leader joined French officials in commemorating the worst atrocity committed by Nazis in France.
lead_paragraph: President Joachim Gauck and President François Hollande of France joined hands on Wednesday in a ceremony commemorating the massacre of Oradour-sur-Glane, in central France, by Nazis.

headline.main: German President Attends World War II Ceremony in France
headline.print_headline: German President Attends World War II Ceremony in France

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
